author: Matt Kairys
comment: When I initially bought this app, it was pretty much completely nonfunctional.  Contacted support, and they genuinely seemed eager to help... But no dice! Alas!  I've checked in a few times, just to see if maybe something got reworked. FINALLY, it appears that the dev has worked out the kinks, and it works pretty... Pretty... Pretty good. UI could use some tweaking, but who am I to complain?! Well done!
title: Great support... And it works!

author: James Nurmi
comment: Three stars - to get the last two it needs any two of the following: - Option to remove the voice button - it being first, and futzy enough to want to remove makes me sad.  Alternatively, allowing reordering of devices/buttons (including the voice one) would be a fine answer here.  - Support unlocking doors - I can't think of the occasion I've had my watch and phone without my keys and wanted to /lock/ the door.  Ideally support both, but if you can only do one, let me choose unlock. - Limited use case - single-toggle-mode;  On opening the app, toggle a single thing (like say, my lock) automatically - a la open app, unlock door automatically, done.  All around it's pretty good, but with my home devices always listening anyhow - the thing I want my smartwatch to be able to do is manipulate my smartlock.

author: Nick
comment: It's great since it's the only app that lets you control smartthings from your watch but wish the interface would be a little more intuitive. Scrolling through 15 switches if you don't want to use voice is no fun. Still appreciate it and will support the developer to encourage more updates to the app!

author: Stephen Roberts
comment: I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews -- it works flawlessly and I couldn't be happier. It's nice being able to open up locks, my garage, and lights all using my watch!

author: Michael Ruotolo
comment: App just crashes. Is this app even supported?

author: Benjamin Ferdinand
comment: Much better response time than IFTTT for unlocking doors, could you possibly put an option to remove the voice option/icon? as it just takes me longer to get to the command I need.
title: Works great

author: Ben Cheng
comment: Works OK for me. I'd like a visual indicator of whether a switch is on or off as well. The addition of routines will result in a 5 star rating.

author: Gee Atwal
comment: Voice needs some work doesn't recognize gee ends up using gps other than that works
title: Voice

author: Matthew Johnson
comment: Works much better for my needs now. Found that for the garage door control to work the device handler needs to be updated..

author: Jeff Johnson
comment: Maybe include a list of UNsupported watches.  IE Pebble.

author: Jacob Figgins
comment: Exactly what the title says! I downloaded it and connected to ST and it worked! Amazing! Although, it would be nice when it is off for it to turn gray and green when it is on.
title: Amazing and Easy!

author: Adam F
comment: Good job.  Working now.

author: Timothy Mann
comment: Had issues at first, but latest update seems to have fixed the problems.

reply.author: Jordan Rejaud
reply.content: Hi Tim, the app should be fixed in the latest version. If it's working for you now please update your review (or let me know if it's still not working)

author: Henrik Pfluger
comment: A must for everyone using a SmartThings hub and Android Wear. Jordan the developer was great in fixing a bug that kept me from using this. Excellent developer support!  I have been using this for a couple days now and it is great to be able to switch my lights on/off from my wrist.  Now all it needs is more devices per screen so I do not have to scroll so much and showing the devices' current status (on/off).  Thanks for the app, keep up the great work!

reply.author: Jordan Rejaud
reply.content: Hi Henrik, can you provide me with a list of your device names (along with which ones have this label issue)? Haven't seen this bug yet.
